info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 10:22AM CDT until April 03 at 10:20AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Meramec River near Sullivan. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River near Sullivan. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The main entrance gate at Onondaga Cave State Park begins flooding near this height. This may force the park to use the rear entrance as the primary entrance to the park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 13.5 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The river began rising Wednesday evening and rose above flood stage early Thursday morning. It crested near 16.5 feet at 8:30 PM on Thursday. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to below 9 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Meramec River Sullivan 11.0 13.5 Fri 9 am 9.8 7.5 6.7 6.0 5.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
